eligible.eligiblityText: This offense is likely eligible for expungement.
eligible.helperText: ...this is what you should do next in this case...

ineligible.eligiblityText: This offense is ineligible for expungement.
ineligible.helperText: ...this is what you should do next in this case...

ineligible-at-this-time.eligiblityText: This offense is ineligible at this time for expungement.
ineligible-at-this-time.helperText: ...this is what you should do next in this case...

0.questionText: Do you have a case pending?
helperText: "Pending" refers to any case that is pending or has not been fully resolved. For example, if a case does not have a case disposition, it is likely a case pending.

1.questionText: Are you sealing a conviction or a non-conviction?
helperText: "Convicted" refers to the judgment (sentence) on a verdict or a finding of guilty, a plea of guilty or a plea of nolo contendere, or a plea or verdict of not guilty by reason of insanity.

2.questionText: Is this an eligible misdemeanor/felony or an ineligible misdemeanor/felony?

3.questionText: Have you subsequently been convicted of another crime in any jurisdiction?

4.questionText: Has it been 8 years since you were off papers?
helperText: "Off papers" means when a person has been unconditionally discharged from incarceration, commitment, probation, parole or supervised release – whichever is the latest.

5.questionText: Is your non-conviction the result of a Deferred Sentencing Agreement?

6.questionText: Do you also have an ineligible conviction on your record?

7.questionText: Do you also have an ineligible conviction on your record?

8.questionText: Is the non-conviction for an eligible misdemeanor or an ineligible misdemeanor/felony?

9.questionText: Was the case terminated before charging by the prosectution (no papered)?

10.questionText: Has it been 4 years since you were "off papers" for the felony non-conviction?
helperText: "Off papers" means when a person has been unconditionally discharged from incarceration, commitment, probation, parole or supervised release – whichever is the latest.

11.questionText: Has it been 3 years since you were "off papers" for the felony non-conviction?
helperText: "Off papers" means when a person has been unconditionally discharged from incarceration, commitment, probation, parole or supervised release – whichever is the latest.

12.questionText: Has it been two years since you were "off papers" for the misdemeanor non-conviction?
helperText: "Off papers" means when a person has been unconditionally discharged from incarceration, commitment, probation, parole or supervised release – whichever is the latest.

13.questionText: Is the ineligible conviction for a felony or misdemeanor?

14.questionText: Has it been 10 years since you were "off papers" for the misdemeanor conviction?
helperText: "Off papers" means when a person has been unconditionally discharged from incarceration, commitment, probation, parole or supervised release – whichever is the latest.

15.questionText: Has it been 5 years since you were "off papers" for the misdemeanor conviction?
helperText: "Off papers" means when a person has been unconditionally discharged from incarceration, commitment, probation, parole or supervised release – whichever is the latest.
